episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including a pub in London named after Bill Murray's historical namesake, the rivalry between artists over the world's blackest black and pinkest pink, the use of submarines for cocaine smuggling, and the variations of the Cyclops myth across cultures.

facts.fact: A pub in London has just renamed itself the Bill Murray. However, because they couldn't get his permission they had to name it after William Murray who was King Charles the first's whipping boy instead.
It is impossible to paint a picture with the world's blackest black and the world's pinkest pink because it's a really bad clash.
At least 30% of the cocaine in America arrives by submarine.
In the Greek Odysseus myth, he escapes the Cyclops by hiding under one of the Cyclops' sheep. In the Apache version of the same myth, he escapes by hiding in the anus of a buffalo.
